title: Why El Salvador's president wants everyone to know about his new prison
description: Last week, El Salvador's president Nayib Bukele posted a typically divisive video on Twitter. To the sound of thrilling fast-paced music, it showed hundreds of detainees being transferred to a new "megaprison" officially named the Center for Confining Terrorism. Constructed last year to host the Central American country's burgeoning prison population, it is the largest prison in the Americas, with capacity for 40,000 inmates.

title: Mexican president: Those who are responsible will be punished
description: The two Americans who authorities say were kidnapped in Mexico and found dead have been identified as Shaeed Woodard and Zindell Brown, a US official familiar with the ongoing investigation tells CNN. The two survivors have been identified as Latavia Washington McGee and Eric Williams, according to the source. CNN's Rosa Flores has more.

title: See the extreme lengths Oscar nominee went through to retain movie rights
description: In an interview with CNN's Christina Macfarlane, Oscar-nominated screenwriter and triathlete Lesley Paterson explains the extreme lengths she went through to maintain the option for movie rights to the book "All Quiet on the Western Front."

title: See McConnell's reaction to Tucker Carlson's Fox News segment
description: Fox News host Tucker Carlson is facing blow back from Republican leaders for peddling new falsehoods about the January 6 Capitol riot.

title: Holi is a celebration of love, color and spring
description: Millions of people in India and around the world celebrating Holi this week.

title: SUV crashes through cafe window while podcasters record
description: Nathan Reeves was recording a podcast session a with guest, Alexsey Reyes, when a black SUV crashed into the cafe in Houston.

title: TikTok's new beauty filter is so realistic people think it's problematic
description: The new "Bold Glamour" filter on TikTok uses machine learning technology to automatically edit users facial features. Hear why some people are disturbed by how it makes their faces look

title: The other two missing Americans were found alive, but one of them was injured, Tamaulipas governor says
Go ahead and sigh. It's good for you
description: Sighs — those long, exhales of breath often accompanied with a bit of a whimper — have long been seen as a sigh of melancholy, frustration or even despair, leading us to ask the sighing person, "What's wrong?"

title: Musk mocks Twitter worker with disability who was unsure if he'd been laid off
description: Elon Musk publicly scoffed at a Twitter employee's uncertainty about whether he had been laid off in a recent round of cuts and spoke dismissively of the employee's disability in a series of tweets Monday night. It's the latest example of the billionaire openly antagonizing his company's current and former staffers.

title: Couple jailed for stealing $1.7 million of wine from Michelin-starred restaurant
description: A couple who stole a haul of wine valued at $1.7 million from a Michelin-starred Spanish restaurant have been sentenced to four years in prison.

title: Zelensky warns of 'open road' through Ukraine's east if Russia captures Bakhmut
description:
• Live: Russia suffers 'significant losses' in Bakhmut, says Ukraine 
• Video: Wolf Blitzer presses Zelensky on Bakhmut strategy

title: Watch Wolf Blitzer press Zelensky on Bakhmut strategy
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky speaks to CNN's Wolf Blitzer about his military strategy as Russian forces continue to make gradual gains in the city of Bakhmut. Watch the full exclusive interview on Wednesday, March 8 at 9 p.m. ET.

title: Stress may lead to lower cognitive function, study finds
description: People with elevated stress levels are more likely to experience a decline in cognitive function, a new study found, affecting their capacity to remember, concentrate and learn new things.

title: Mexican officials set to address kidnapping in news conferences
The other two missing Americans were found alive, but one of them was injured, Tamaulipas governor says
2 Americans kidnapped in Mexico found dead and 2 found alive, Mexican officials say
Zelensky warns of 'open road' through Ukraine's east if Russia captures Bakhmut
US Capitol Police chief rips into Tucker Carlson over 'offensive' use of January 6 footage
description: US Capitol Police Chief Tom Manger on Tuesday ripped into Fox News host Tucker Carlson over his commentary about footage from the January 6, 2021, insurrection that he aired Monday night, saying the host "cherry-picked" from the footage to present "offensive" and "misleading" conclusions about the attack.

title: Arnold Schwarzenegger says antisemites will 'die miserably' in lengthy video
description: Arnold Schwarzenegger would like to terminate antisemitism and hate.

title: Desert X: Monumental new artworks rise in Coachella Valley
description: The sprawling, arid art biennial Desert X has returned to California, featuring open-air installations by 12 artists around the Coachella Valley, set against the neutral hues of shrublands and sandy terrain, the greenery of Palm Springs, and distant snow-capped mountains.

title: Hayden Panettiere makes first red carpet appearance since her brother's death
description: Hayden Panettiere walked the red carpet for the first time since the death of her brother, Jansen Panettiere, who died last month at just 28 years old.

title: At least 6 Palestinians killed in Israeli military operation in West Bank, Palestinian officials say
description: At least six Palestinians were killed in an Israeli military raid into the Jenin refugee camp in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said.

title: FBI: Americans were 'placed in a vehicle and taken from scene by armed men' in Matamoros on Friday
description: [Breaking news update, 10:18 a.m. ET]

title: US Justice Department sues to block JetBlue's purchase of Spirit Airlines
description: The US Justice Department is suing to stop JetBlue's proposed $3.8 billion deal to buy discount carrier Spirit Airlines, the first time in more than 20 years that the government has sought to block a US airline merger.

title: Video shows Americans kidnapped in Mexico being loaded into pickup truck
description: Two of the four Americans who authorities say were kidnapped in Mexico have been found dead, according to Tamaulipas Gov. Américo Villarreal Anaya. One of the two survivors has injuries, he said.

title: 'They die as miserably as they lived:' Arnold Schwarzenegger calls out antisemitism
description: Arnold Schwarzenegger, the Austrian-born actor and former governor of California, posted a video on his social media platforms calling out hate speech and confronting the rise in antisemitism.

title: Texas sued by women who say state's abortion bans put their health at risk
description: Several women who say Texas' abortion bans posed significant risks to their health have sued the state this week, opening a new front in the legal battles that have emerged since the Supreme Court overturned national abortion rights protections last year.

title: Here's why these photos can make for a bad dating profile
description: Love putting friends in your profile pics to show how fun you are? Think writing "loves to travel" is winning you points in all the apps? Think again. Singles pay online dating coach Erika Ettin hundreds of dollars to help them find love and she has some solid tips for you.

title: Zelensky vows justice after video appears to show Ukrainian soldier's execution
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has vowed to "find the murderers" involved in a video that he said showed the execution of a Ukrainian soldier by Russian troops, as officials in Kyiv roundly condemned the incident as a war crime.

title: WeightWatchers jumps into into the prescription weight loss drug business
description: WeightWatchers is getting into the booming prescription weight loss drug business.

title: Toyota's new Prius may be the best argument yet for hybrids
description: After I parked a new 2023 Toyota Prius and walked away, I turned around to look at it. Not because I was checking my parking job, but because it just looked so good. Turning around to look at a Prius is, seriously, something I never thought I would do.

title: Pritzker Prize 2023: David Chipperfield wins 'Nobel of architecture'
description: Throughout its 44-year history, the Pritzker Prize — regarded as the "Nobel of architecture" — has often been awarded to individuals with distinct design signatures: Frank Gehry's irregular forms, Zaha Hadid's sweeping curves, Tadao Ando's textural concrete.

title: What happens to your body on a long-haul flight
description: If crowded airports are a sign, travelers are keen to get back into the skies. And if you're flying long haul, in a few years you could have an even longer option.

title: Michelle Obama opens up about her 'uncontrollable sobbing' on day of Trump's inauguration
description: Michelle Obama broke down shortly after leaving then-President Donald Trump's inauguration, the former first lady candidly shared in a new podcast, as the emotions of leaving their family's home after eight years and resentment over Trump taking office overwhelmed her.

title: Images show AI detecting breast cancer 4 years before it developed
description: CNN's Poppy Harlow speaks with Dr. Larry Norton, the medical director of the Lauder Breast Center at the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, about the use of artificial intelligence in breast cancer detection.

title: Man arrested after allegedly trying to open door on plane and stab flight attendant
description: A Massachusetts man was arrested for allegedly attempting to stab a flight attendant in the neck with a broken metal spoon three times during a flight from Los Angeles to Boston, attempting to open an emergency exit door, according to the Justice Department.

title: Ticketmaster crashes again as Eurovision fans rush to snag tickets
description: Fans of the Eurovision Song Contest crashed Ticketmaster Tuesday, almost four months after the ticketing website suffered a similar collapse under the weight of huge demand for tickets to Taylor Swift concerts.

title: Hear Wagner leader's warning to Russian Defense Ministry
description: CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports on the standoff between Yevgeny Prigozhin of Wagner and the Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu.

title: Archaeologists uncover sphinx-like statue and shrine in Egypt
description: A new sphinx-like statue has been discovered in Egypt -- but this one is thought to be Roman.

title: Fox News airs first clips of exclusive Jan. 6th footage
description: Fox News host Tucker Carlson aired newly released footage from the January 6, 2021, US Capitol attack, that included images of the rioter known as the "QAnon Shaman," as well as of Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick, who died following the attack.

title: Asthma, cancer, erectile drugs sent from abroad make up are most confiscations, despite opioid claims
description: For years, the FDA has defended its efforts to intercept prescription drugs coming from abroad by mail as necessary to keep out dangerous opioids, including fentanyl.

title: Watchdog says US cyber agency lacks a plan for communicating during major hacks
description: More than two years after an alleged Russian hacking campaign exposed glaring weakness in US federal defenses, the Department of Homeland Security's cyber agency has not updated a key agency blueprint for maintaining communications in the event of a major hack, the department's inspector general said Monday.

title: UEFA to issue refunds to Liverpool fans with tickets for 2022 Champions League final
description: UEFA plans to refund all Liverpool supporters who had tickets for the 2022 Champions League Final in Paris, the governing body of European soccer announced on Tuesday.

title: US defense secretary makes unannounced trip to Iraq
description: US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin made an unannounced trip to Baghdad on Tuesday, according to the US press pool traveling with him.

title: Europe is trying to ditch planes for trains. Here's how that's going
description: Ever since the "flight shame" movement began encouraging travelers to seek greener alternatives to jet planes, many in Europe have been looking to the continent's extensive rail network to replace short-haul air travel.

title: Uber is making it easier to find your ride at the airport
description: Uber on Tuesday unveiled some new product features that aim to make it easier for you to find your ride at the airport.

title: What to know about the controversial Willow oil drilling project in Alaska
description: The Biden administration is expected to make a decision soon on whether to approve the controversial Willow Project in Alaska.

title: Marijuana legalization is on the ballot in Oklahoma on Tuesday: Here's what to know
description: Oklahoma voters on Tuesday will decide whether to legalize recreational marijuana in a special election.

title: Paris Saint-Germain forward Neymar to undergo ankle surgery and miss remainder of the season
description: Paris Saint-Germain will be without star forward Neymar for the remainder of the season after it was announced the Brazilian will have to undergo surgery on his ankle injury.

title: Sri Lanka expects approval of $2.9 billion IMF deal after China support
description: Sri Lanka expects final approval from the International Monetary Fund for a $2.9 billion loan in the third or fourth week of this month, the president said on Tuesday, adding that new support from China means all funding requirements had been met.

title: Boston Red Sox third baseman Justin Turner receives 16 stitches after taking pitch to the face
description: Boston Red Sox third baseman Justin Turner is resting at home after he was hit in the face by a pitch which required 16 stitches.

title: France braced for major disruption as strikes over pension reform hit airports, trains
description: French schools, airports and trains will face heavy disruption Tuesday for the sixth time this year, as unions galvanize people nationwide in protest against government plans to raise the retirement age for most workers.

title: A takeover battle for the future of K-pop is heating up
description: Kakao, one of South Korea's top internet giants, has doubled down on its quest to take control of SM Entertainment, the iconic K-pop music agency.

title: After 'a lot of down times' in 2022, Brooks Koepka is out of his 'funk' and chasing a fifth major
description: For Brooks Koepka, picking his favorite major win is akin to choosing a favorite child.

title: Conor Benn has 'serious concerns' over boxing's drug testing
description: Conor Benn's scheduled fight with Chris Eubank Jr. last year was meant to be career defining for both men.

title: Xi Jinping hits out at US as he urges China's private firms to 'fight' alongside Communist Party
description: China's leader Xi Jinping hit out at the United States with unusually direct comments as he called on the country's private companies to "fight" alongside the Communist Party at a time of mounting challenges at home and abroad.

title: China has a new foreign minister. This is his warning to the US
description: China's new Foreign Minister Qin Gang warned that "conflict and confrontation" with the United States is inevitable if Washington does not change course, delivering a stern and wide-ranging rebuke of US policies for his first press conference in the new role. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports.

title: Alligator allegedly taken from Texas zoo as an egg or hatchling has been returned nearly 20 years later, officials say
description: A nearly 8-foot alligator that allegedly was taken from a Texas zoo nearly 20 years ago as an egg or a hatchling has been returned to the facility after it was spotted living illegally in the backyard of a home near Austin, officials say.

title: Thailand jails five poachers for killing tiger and her cub
description: A court in western Thailand on Monday sentenced five poachers to prison terms of five years each for killing a female tiger and her cub in a national park last year.

title: Japan's new rocket fails on debut launch in setback for space program
description: Japan's maiden launch of its new flagship space rocket ended in failure on Tuesday when controllers issued a destruct command just 15 minutes after liftoff, the country's space agency said.

title: Gender equality will take 300 years to achieve, UN chief warns
description: Progress toward gender equality is "vanishing before our eyes," United Nations Secretary General António Guterres told the Commission on the Status of Women on Monday.

title: Qin Gang said good relations were 'imperative' and also compared any possible future Chinese arms support to Russia with US weapons sales to Taiwan
China's new foreign minister warns of conflict with US, defends Russia ties
description: China's new Foreign Minister Qin Gang warned Tuesday that "conflict and confrontation" with the United States is inevitable if Washington does not change course, delivering a stern and wide-ranging rebuke of US policies for his first press conference in the new role.

title: Why the 2024 shadow campaign between Trump and DeSantis should worry Ukraine
One of India's trash mountains is on fire again and residents are choking on its toxic fumes
China's foreign minister equates possible supply of weapons to Russia with US military support for Taiwan
China's foreign minister equates possible supply of weapons to Russia with US military support for Taiwan
She created a relationship with a chatbot. 11 messages in, it got weird
description: Dr. Marisa T. Cohen, a marriage and family therapist, created an AI chatbot boyfriend and reveals the details of the brief relationship.

title: Hear January 6 prisoner choir song that features Trump
description: A new single released by a choir of men who are in prison for their participation in the attack on the US Capitol on January 6, features a recording by former President Donald Trump as the backtrack. CNN's Anderson Cooper reports.

title: Jill Biden reacts to son Hunter being a target of Republicans
description: CNN's Arlette Saenz asks first lady Jill Biden about the scrutiny facing her son Hunter Biden and the classified documents found in her family's possession.

title: What 'Everything Everywhere' has taught us about racism and representation in Hollywood
description: "Everything Everywhere All at Once" features a dizzying array of plot twists as failing laundromat owner Evelyn Wang learns she's actually a superhero fighting to save her family and the world.

title: Afghan women protest outside Kabul University as male students return to class
description: Young Afghan women gathered outside Kabul University on Monday to protest the ruling Taliban's ban on female education as their male peers returned to school for a new academic year and the United Nations heard the restriction may amount to a crime against humanity.

title: Man arrested after allegedly trying to stab flight attendant with broken spoon
description: A Massachusetts man was arrested for allegedly attempting to stab a flight attendant in the neck with a broken metal spoon three times during a flight from Los Angeles to Boston on Monday, after attempting to open an emergency exit door, according to the Justice Department.

title: Zelensky responds to video showing apparent execution of unarmed Ukrainian soldier
description: Horrific video appears to show a Ukrainian soldier, allegedly a prisoner of war, executed seemingly by Russian soldiers after he says: "Glory to Ukraine." CNN's Erin Burnett reports.

title: Jill Biden weighs in on classified docs found at the president's Delaware home
description: First lady Dr. Jill Biden warned parts of East Africa are "on the precipice" of famine as the region is dealing with a severe drought, threatening livelihoods and the ability of families to feed their children.

title: Hear why Haberman thinks Trump isn't calling DeSantis out by name
description: CNN political analyst and senior political correspondent for the New York Times Maggie Haberman discusses what she thinks is a strategy being employed by former President Donald Trump in his bid for the presidency in the 2024 election.

title: Why sub-Saharan migrants are repatriating instead of staying in Tunisia
description: Controversial comments from Tunisian President Kais Saied are causing sub-Saharan migrants to repatriate after feeling unsafe in Tunisia. CNN's Larry Madowo reports on recent actions that show signs of the country's democracy "slipping away."

title: Explosion of sea lion deaths in Peru amid deadly bird flu outbreak
description: Thousands of sea lions have died in Peru amid an outbreak of bird flu, according to Peru's National Service of Protected Areas by the State (SERNANP).
